result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Hearing on July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:02 AM Defendant Brian J Schroeder appeared by Zoom with attorney Sarah A Ponath who appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Victim C appears by Zoom.  Victim C previously filed on May 9, 2022 a request for a no violent contact order and for the defendant to be allowed to have contact with Victim A and Victim B on May 28, 2022 for a wedding reception.  The Court orders the State to determine whether notice has been given to Victim A's and Victim B's biological father unless there is some sort of Court order terminating those parental rights.  The State continues to object to any modification of bail.  Attorney Ponath makes statements regarding the request of Victim A.  The Court will deny the request of Victim C and not make any sort of modification of bail.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM Defendant Brian J Schroeder in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A appeared by Zoom with victim/witness specialist Jennifer Ellenson who appeared by Zoom.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $125.00 per month commencing June 1, 2022.
The Court makes the Petition of Court Appointed Attorney filed on April 29, 2022 and the one filed today as confidential as it has names of the victims and witnesses listed in the victim ID key.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP A PAYMENT PLAN.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Hearing on May 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within .25 mile of Victim A/Victim B, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant is not be located near any school or daycares.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

02:10 PM Defendant Brian J Schroeder in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tapia appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Witness A appeared by Zoom and makes statements regarding bail.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
